docs.lead_paragraph: Doctors have found that Ebola can linger in some male survivors for up to nine months but aren't sure if that means they might still be infectious, according to new research.

headline.main: Study: Ebola in Male Survivors Can Survive Up to 9 Months
headline.print_headline: Study: Ebola in Male Survivors Can Survive Up to 9 Months

docs.snippet: Doctors have found that Ebola can linger in some male survivors for up to nine months but aren't sure if that means they might still be infectious, according to new research.

headline.main: Women With Essure Contraceptive Implant Needed More Surgeries, Study Finds
headline.print_headline: Women With Essure Sterilization Implant Needed More Surgery, Researchers Say

docs.abstract: Women who sought sterilization through the Essure implant were far more likely to be back for surgery within a year than women who had their tubes tied, the study found.
docs.snippet: Women who sought sterilization through the Essure implant were far more likely to be back for surgery within a year than women who had their tubes tied, the study found.

docs.lead_paragraph: A growing number of groups are providing mental health care without clinics or doctors, relying instead on mobile nurses, cheap generic drugs and community support systems.

headline.main: In West Africa, a Mission to Save Minds

docs.abstract: Growing number of advocacy groups are treating people suffering from mental disorders in West Africa with combination of mobile nurses, generic drugs and community support; mental health services are virtually nonexistent in many areas of Africa and Asia (Series: Shackled Minds and Bodies).
docs.snippet: A growing number of groups are providing mental health care without clinics or doctors, relying instead on mobile nurses, cheap generic drugs and community support systems.

headline.main: Fighting New Diseases by Giving Them Blander Labels
headline.print_headline: ‘You Discovered It, You Name It’ Is Out

docs.abstract: The World Health Organization issued strict guidelines for naming infections. For example, names of groups (Legionnaire’s) and places (Ebola) are out.
docs.snippet: The World Health Organization issued strict guidelines for naming infections. For example, names of groups (Legionnaire’s) and places (Ebola) are out.

docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. prices for the world's 20 top-selling medicines are, on average, three times higher than in Britain, according to an analysis carried out for Reuters.

headline.main: Exclusive-Transatlantic Divide: How U.S. Pays Three Times More for Drugs
headline.print_headline: Exclusive-Transatlantic Divide: How U.S. Pays Three Times More for Drugs

docs.lead_paragraph: In parts of West Africa, religious retreats set up camps for people with mental illnesses, where patients are frequently shackled and prayer is often the only treatment.

headline.main: The Chains of Mental Illness in West Africa
headline.print_headline: The Chains of Mental Illness Across West Africa

docs.abstract: Most common form of treatment for those suffering from mental illness in Togo are makeshift psychiatric camps where sufferers are chained to concrete blocks or trees; Togo is representative of West Africa in general dearth of services for mentally ill; issue of how to improve services for mentally ill has drawn renewed focus in wake of United Nations development goal that makes mental health services priority in developing world (Series: Shackled Minds and Bodies).
docs.snippet: In parts of West Africa, religious retreats set up camps for people with mental illnesses, where patients are frequently shackled and prayer is often the only treatment.

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject

byline.contributor: Samuel Kpavouvou contributed reporting from Kpove and Djagblé, Togo.

docs.lead_paragraph: In a story Oct. 12 about gun violence research, The Associated Press reported erroneously that Newtown, Connecticut, was the deadliest mass slaying at a school in U.S. history. With 26 victims, it was the second-deadliest shooting at a school; 32 were killed at Virginia Tech in 2007. The worst attack at an elementary school was a 1927 bombing that killed 38 children in Bath Township, Michigan. The story also gave the wrong location for the Colorado School of Public Health; it is in the Denver suburb of Aurora, not Denver.
docs.snippet: In a story Oct. 12 about gun violence research, The Associated Press reported erroneously that Newtown, Connecticut, was the deadliest mass slaying at a school in U.S. history. With 26 victims, it was the second-deadliest shooting at a school; 32...

docs.lead_paragraph: The benefits of restoring our microbial system become more and more obvious. We need a way to make this system reboot easier.

headline.main: Should We Bank Our Own Stool?
headline.print_headline: Should We Bank Our Own Stool?

docs.abstract: Moises Velasquez-Manoff Op-Ed article hails benefits of fecal transplant to help patients recover their own microbial blueprint and protect against infection and disease.
docs.snippet: The benefits of restoring our microbial system become more and more obvious. We need a way to make this system reboot easier.

docs.lead_paragraph: California has adopted the toughest limits in the nation on the use of antibiotics in healthy livestock, barring their routine use to prevent illness or promote growth.

headline.main: California Adopts Strictest Limits on Livestock Antibiotics
headline.print_headline: California Adopts Strictest Limits on Livestock Antibiotics

docs.snippet: California has adopted the toughest limits in the nation on the use of antibiotics in healthy livestock, barring their routine use to prevent illness or promote growth.
